etymology.description: Depicts open country with three lines representing the territory outside city walls
etymology.interpretation: 冂(冂) (jiōng, "open country") effectively represents an unbounded area, signifying the open and vast spaces beyond city boundaries, aligning with the concept of an uncontaminated countryside.

examples.chinese: 这个字的偏旁冂(冂)，显示了开放乡村的意境(顯示了開放鄉村的意境)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège zì de piānpáng jiōng, xiǎnshìle kāifàng xiāngcūn de yìjìng.
examples.english: The radical '冂' in this character reveals the imagery of an open countryside.

examples.chinese: 在古文献中(在古文獻中)，冂常被用来象征广大国土(冂常被用來象徵廣大國土)。
examples.pinyin: Zài gǔwénxiàn zhōng, jiōng cháng bèi yòng lái xiàngzhēng guǎngdà guótǔ.
examples.english: In ancient texts, '冂' was often used to symbolize vast territories.
